result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen

records.addlTxt: Defendant Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen not in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant extradited to State of Florida. Bond remains. Warrant to issue. Minutes filed.
Letter from examiner
Order for Examination under 971.16, Wis. Stats. (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)

Defendant Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
with Exhibit #1 attached
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved and Not guilty by reason of mental disease/defect.

3:40 PM (64-06) Defendant Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State called to the stand as a witness Mathew Ludowise.
Mathew Ludowise duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA TenHaken. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered.
Cross examination by Attorney Renner.
3:47PM - Re-direct by ADA TenHaken.
3:48PM - Re-cross by Attorney Renner.
Exhibit #1 received by the Court.
Evidence is closed.
3:49PM - Argument by the State, requesting bind over.
Attorney Renner objects to the bind over.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him/her over to stand trial on the charges. 
Attorney Renner acknowledge receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty by reason of mental disease/defect to all charges on behalf of her client.
Speedy Trial reserved.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Mackenzie Renner
Signed bond filed with the court.
Victim's Request to Lift the No Contact

*AMENDED: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH A.P. OR RESIDENCE. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. MUST COMPLY WITH ALL COUNSELING, THERAPY PROGRAMS AND MEDICATION ORDERS. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen in court.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner for defendant. Victim A.P. in court and makes statement. Bond amended to violent contact with victim. and other conditions. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested. Time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Andrew Herrmann appearing on behalf of the State of Wisconsin. Victim also present in court and makes statement. New Beginnings paperwork provided and procedure advised. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
NOTICE OF ARREST
Signed bond filed with the court.
SEE SIGNATURE BOND FOR CONDITIONS

*AMENDED: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH A.P. OR RESIDENCE. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. MUST COMPLY WITH ALL COUNSELING, THERAPY PROGRAMS AND MEDICATION ORDERS. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. 

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1500 CASH (POSTED ON 9/9/2022)
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.P. OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-4094 thru 22-4098, 22-4104
